availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Illinois soldier. Massachusetts native. Son of Joshua G. Dickson and Sarah Dickson. Enrolled as a freshman at Harvard College in 1851. Served in Company F of the 12th Regiment Illinois (Three Months' Volunteers) as Second Lieutenant from April 27, 1861 to May 11, 1861. Served in Company F of the 12th Regiment Illinois as First Lieutenant from May 11, 1861. Student in Hamilton County, Ohio in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Mill Creek, p. 68A.
U.S. School Catalogs, 1765-1935, Harvard College, 1851, p. 35.
Annual Report of the Adjutant General of the State of IllinoisU.S. Adjustant General Military Records, 1631-1976, Illinois 1861-1862.
Find A Grave, "Maj J. Bates Dickson (Feb 9, 1833-Feb 21, 1877)," Memorial #109784356, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/109784356 (accessed May 26, 2020).
